SEARCH
Package com.mimecast.robin.config.client

Class EnvelopeConfig

java.lang.Object
com.mimecast.robin.config.ConfigFoundation
com.mimecast.robin.config.client.EnvelopeConfig
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class EnvelopeConfig extends ConfigFoundation
Case envelope configuration container.

This is a container for envelopes defined in a case configuration.

One instance will be made for every envelope defined.

This will be used to collect the necessary data to generate the MessageEnvelope.

See Also:
  • CaseConfig
  • MessageEnvelope
  • Serialized Form

      public int getChunkSize()

      Size of how many bytes to write to the socket in one write.

      Returns:
      Chunk size in bytes.

    • isChunkBdat

      public boolean isChunkBdat()
      Is chunk BDAT command.

      This makes the client write the BDAT command with the first chunk of the message.

      This can uncover accidental buffer clearing when switching from SMTP to MIME mode.

      Returns:
      Boolean.

    • isChunkWrite

      public boolean isChunkWrite()
      Is chunk write randomly.

      This will write random size chunks from chunk size chunks.

      The chunks are limited to in between 1024 and 2048 bytes so chunk size must be >= to 2048.

      Returns:
      Boolean.

    • getTerminateAfterBytes

      public int getTerminateAfterBytes()
      Gets terminate after bytes.

      Size of how many bytes to write to the socket before terminating connection.

      Returns:
      Size in bytes.

    • isTerminateBeforeDot

      public boolean isTerminateBeforeDot()
      Is terminate before dot.

      Terminate connection before transmitting the <CRLF>.<CRLF> termiantor.

      Returns:
      Boolean.

    • isTerminateAfterDot

      public boolean isTerminateAfterDot()
      Is terminate after dot.

      Terminate connection after transmitting the <CRLF>.<CRLF> termiantor.

      Returns:
      Boolean.

    • getSlowBytes

      public int getSlowBytes()
      Gets slow bytes.

      This adds a write delay every given number of bytes.

      Returns:
      Size in bytes.
